content.question: Two identical spoons were electroplated with <math alttext="A g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="C d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cd</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> through the use of the electrolytic cells illustrated above. A current of <math alttext="5.00 amperes" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was supplied to each cell for 600. seconds, and the masses of the spoons before and after the electroplating were recorded. Which of the following mathematical equations can best be used to account for the much larger increase in mass of the spoon electroplated with <math alttext="A g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> compared with the spoon electroplated with <math alttext="C d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cd</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta G naught equals delta H naught minus T delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta G naught equals negative R T, natural log of K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E equals E naught minus the fraction R T over n F, end fraction, times the natural log of Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>−</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow></mfrac><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="I equals the fraction q over t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="I equals the fraction q over t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
